Text.Value: They're protected from the curse by a power like your lantern - but weaker.
Do not question your superiors, creature. My orders come directly from the Absolute.
You never said there were others out here. Who are they?
Because their gods are weaker. None compare to the Absolute.
Yes, we have our duty. We shall lead them home, Majesty.
A True Soul. Why would one of our queen's blessed walk with Harpers?
*Your minds connect and you hear a whispered voice. The Absolute? Or just the echoes of his fractured mind, reverberating in the dark?*
They are holier than me - a greater part of Her design! I was wrong to question them!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: detect thoughts node - this is the creature's thoughts rather than direct speech
EditorData.NodeContext: detect thoughts node - this is the creature's thoughts rather than direct speech

Text.Value: Search his mind.
They will hurry, Majesty. They must not keep you waiting.
Very well. We welcome all who follow our holy queen.
It was a pleasure to kill by your side. Onwards, in death!
You feel a familiar power from the bodies. Try to find its source.
Give me a moment, I'm not ready to go yet.
To Moonrise, then - lead the way.
You will wipe away all opposition, Majesty. Nothing can stand in the way of Your glory.
And heretics must be destroyed.
Don't you dare speak to me, you abomination!
But they will fail. They cannot hope to stand in our way, Majesty.
Perhaps they wish to stop our Queen's great mission. But we are not concerned.
Attack the creature.
I need a moment to look around.
*Aside from the wounds of battle, you can't see anything unusual.*
They think us fools, Majesty. They think we don't see through their lies!
These corpses have a strange power about them. Drink it in. Swim in it.
Examine one of the bodies, looking for the magic protecting them out here.
But no matter, Majesty. They are already dead, and soon forgotten.
I infiltrated their ranks - gathering information for our cause.
You feel a familiar power from the bodies. Try to find its source.
And what of the strange little turncoat, Majesty? Should we spare them?

EditorData.logicalname: Greeting - Players changed from harpers to caravan side

Text.Value: What are Harpers doing here?
Good. Take me to Moonrise.
The sooner we reach Moonrise, the sooner you will see Her power.
'They' just need another moment. I won't be long.
Follow close. We shall lead them home, Majesty.
Are they ready to depart? We do not want to linger in the shadows, Majesty.
Wretched little things. No better than the shadows.
Yes, yes, of course. Her grace burns bright in them - I see it!
So many voices inside my mind, so many - but these ones are tricksters and thieves!

EditorData.NodeContext: angry and confused - somebody just tried to steal thougths from your mind

Text.Value: Very well. We depart when you are ready.
Follow close - the shadows are hungry. Do not stray from the light.
*You can feel the power it held - weak, but still divine. These soldiers were protected from the shadows by your own lady Selûne.*
Do not linger. Must not linger.
I answer to the Absolute, not to you.
Yes. We lead the way.
We will wait, but not for long.
All right, let's go.
It's over now. Let's go.
I'm ready. Let's go.
Come, follow us to Moonrise Towers. Then you will see Her power in all its glory.
Harpers. Spies. Little scurrying rats, trying to stop our queen's great mission.
You'll wait here. I'll tell you when I'm ready.
*You can feel the power it held - weak, but still divine. These soldiers were protected from Your Lady's shadows by her wretched sister Selûne.*
They must get on. They must hurry.
Let's go. We need to reach Moonrise.
All dead, majesty. It is time for us to move on.
*You can feel the power it held - weak, but still divine. These soldiers were protected from the shadows by a blessing of Selûne.*
How dare they - we are all equal in our queen's crusade. To say otherwise is heresy!
Are they ready, Majesty? Can we leave?

EditorData.logicalname: Greeting - Players changed from harpers to caravan side

Text.Value: Give me a moment. I want to look around.
*You notice something odd on the fallen soldier - a faint glow about the face, like an aura fast-fading.*

Synopsis: While following the caravan, together with the players are ambushed by a group of players. If they side with the drider after the combat resolves it will thank them.
